body.p: Complexity of accounting would be drastically reduced if all financial instruments were measured at fair value. The approach favoured by Mr Leisenring provides at least the following simplifications:

li.p: criteria for when a given instrument must or can be measured with a given attribute are unnecessary.
there is no need to bifurcate embedded derivatives or to identify financial derivatives.
it eliminates the need for fair value hedge accounting for financial instruments.
it eliminates the disparity in the measurement of derivatives within and outside the scope of IAS 39.
it minimises the incentives for structuring transactions to achieve a particular accounting outcome.
no fair value option would be needed to eliminate accounting mismatches.
it provides a superior foundation for developing a comprehensive standard for the derecognition of financial instruments that is not present in a mixed attribute model.
